title.narrative: 7.3. PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By the end of 2022, Federal and states governments have increased capability to identify and use fiscal space to implement policies and programs to reduce multidimensional poverty, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2022, government at federal and state level has implemented NSPP and fiscal policies progressively achieving greater equality

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2022, Federal and states governments have increased capability to identify and use fiscal space to implementpolicies and programs to reduce multidimensional poverty

description.narrative: UNICEF supported evidence generation on fiscal space and budgets at federal and state levels and their linkages to key social sectors affecting children. The evidence produced has been used to build government capacity to improve budget allocations and expenditure for children and inform the development and finalization of child-sensitive State Development Plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
